name: Murali Sreeshankar
biography: Murali Sreeshankar is an Indian long jumper who has made a significant impact in the sport. He is the current national record holder in the men's long jump event and has represented India at several major international competitions, including the 2020 Tokyo Olympics. Sreeshankar is known for his dedication, technical prowess, and consistent performances that have earned him a reputation as one of India's top athletes.
childhood: Murali Sreeshankar was born on 15 March 1999 in Palakkad, Kerala. He took up athletics at a young age and initially competed in sprinting events before transitioning to long jump. Sreeshankar's father, S. Murali, who is a former national champion in long jump, has been a key influence and mentor in his athletic journey.
professional_career: Sreeshankar's professional career has seen steady progress and remarkable achievements. In 2018, he set the national record in the men's long jump event with a jump of 8.20 meters. This achievement earned him a spot at the 2020 Tokyo Olympics, where he finished 13th in the final. Since then, Sreeshankar has continued to excel, winning gold medals at the 2022 Commonwealth Games and the 2022 Asian Games. He is currently ranked among the top long jumpers in the world and is considered a strong contender for medals at major international competitions, including the 2024 Paris Olympics.
